formatDescription: Scribus is an open source desktop publishing application originally created by Franz Schmid. Scribus document files may be compressed within a GZIP container. It may be desirable to distinguish between different versions of Scribus Document.
provenanceCompoundName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

internalSignatures.name: Scribus
internalSignatures.note: BOF: '<SCRIBUS' - this sequence captures the oldest variant to use XML tags, <SCRIBUS> approximately in use for versions 0.3-0.9.*, a later variant <SCRIBUSUTF8 approximately in use for versions 1.0-1.2.*, and an even later variant <SCRIBUSUTF8NEW approximately in use for versions 1.3 onwards. It may be desirable to split these into separate PUIDs.

internalSignatures.name: Scribus version with XML header
internalSignatures.note: BOF: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>.<SCRIBUSUTF8NEW - This variant appears to have been in use from approximately Scribus version 1.3 and later

source.name: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives
